alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 10:24PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northern Livingston, central Tangipahoa and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 1100 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Watson, or 9 miles northeast of Denham Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Denham Springs, Ponchatoula, Walker, Livingston, Independence, Albany, Folsom, Montpelier, Watson, Natalbany, Robert and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 29 and 57. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 28 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena
